text: Denis Hale Johnson (July 1, 1949 – May 24, 2017) was an American writer. He was born in Munich, Germany.Jesse McKinley, "A Prodigal Son Turned Novelist Turns Playwright", The New York Times, June 16, 2002. Johnson best known for his short story collection Jesus' Son (1992) and his novel Tree of Smoke (2007), which won the National Book Award for Fiction. He also wrote plays, poetry and non-fiction. Johnson died at his home on May 24, 2017 in Gualala, California from liver cancer at the age of 67.Carolyn Kellogg, "Award-winning author Denis Johnson dies at age 67," Los Angeles Times, May 26, 2017. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== * Intersection for the Arts, San Francisco * KCRW Bookworm Interview * Profile at The Whiting Foundation * Denis Johnson profile and poems at Academy of American Poets * Denis Johnson at Library of Congress Authorities — with 25 catalog records Category:1949 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:American novelists Category:American playwrights Category:American poets Category:Writers from Munich Category:Writers from Washington (state) Category:O.
